line_1: 'Twas He, ev'n He! my wretched Fate foretold
line_2: Dost thou this Speech then of that Mopsus hold,

line_1: A subtle spright, that opening plots foretold
line_2: By sudden dimness on the beamy gold.

line_1: Visions had oft' his rising fate foretold:
line_2: The last to Jacob thus his lips unfold,

line_1: My honour, and the steward's doom foretold.
line_2: With clear conviction did our lot unfold;
CHRIST the Fathers' Hope of old,

line_1: And fact confirm'd what wisdom thus foretold:
line_2: The hoped day of spousal to with-hold,

line_1: And fact confirm'd what wisdom thus foretold:
line_2: Framing new trains when nought mote serve his old.

line_1: And fact confirm'd what wisdom thus foretold:
line_2: Should sooner down the lowly delve be roll'd,

line_1: This, this is he, that was foretold
line_2: Should emulate our Greeks of old.
Since thy mercies oft of old

line_1: That monster by the oracle foretold,
line_2: In his own image thou shalt then behold,

line_1: The last good King; in ancient days foretold,
line_2: At length, the long-expected Prince behold,

line_1: Or did some ill in mystic leaves foretold,
line_2: And chronicled by gravest seers of old,
